revised_title: The Reflection and Properties of Cathode Rays
tldr: The author investigates the properties of cathode rays, including their magnetic deflection, electrification, and ability to generate X-rays. They discover that reflected cathode rays, now known as electrons, have a negative charge and can cause green fluorescence of glass. The author also explores the potential mechanical force exerted by reflected cathode rays and examines the reflection of cathode rays using a spherically concave reflector.
